I've checked 3 versions of this same torrent, and all of a sudden they're viruses. I had been playing Crysis 3 for the last several days, and all of a sudden today it says I'm missing a file when I try to launch.(cryea.dll, to be exact) 

On top of that, my antivirus is now showing that file as a virus, though it wasn't a few days ago. I've redownloaded the torrent a few times, each time it comes up a virus, and moving the cryea.dll results in weird behaviour like it telling me i don't have admin permission (I do) or just DISAPPEARING when I try to copy it.

http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8200414/Crysis.3.Crackfix.2.INTERNAL-RELOADED has been confirmed as a virus, and the trackers for all the other torrents seem to be the same.

The fact that there's a dozen or so of the same crack-fix torrent is also making this little investigation a pain in the ass.

Anyone else have issues all of sudden?

Yes I had the same problem, is it Microsoft Security Essentials that deletes CryEA.dll as soon as you open any folder containing it.

Looks like an interesting way to get back at us.

Can this crack be used directly over the main download found at 'http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8174928/Crysis.3.INTERNAL-RELOADED'

VirTool:Win32/Obfuscator are detections for programs that have had their purpose obfuscated, often to hinder analysis or detection by antivirus scanners. They commonly employ a combination of methods including encryption, compression, anti-debugging and anti-emulation techniques.

These obfuscation techniques are used on various kinds of malware. The malware that lies "underneath" may have virtually any purpose. Hence, there are no obvious symptoms that indicate the presence of this malware on a computer.

There is no virus. If you don't think that EA reports these cracks to NOD32 then you should do more in depth research. Your fine and continue on
